str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a presumed compound of thumos and machomai; to be in a furious fight, i.e. to be exasperated.
A Tyrian, an inhabitant of Tyre. From Turos; a Tyrian, i.e. Inhabitant of Tyrus.
And, even, also, namely.
Sidonian, inhabitant of Sidon. From Sidon; a Sidonian, i.e. Inhabitant of Sidon.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Adverb from a compound of the base of homou and thumos; unanimously.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
Perhaps the same as the base of blastano; Blastus, an officer of Herod Agrippa.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
A bed-chamber. From koite; a bedroom.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; regal, i.e. belonging to the sovereign, or preeminent.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: A primary verb; properly, to stiffen, i.e. Fatten (with food, etc.), pamper, rear).
